text: John Logie Baird was born in Helensburgh, Scotland. He would grow up to invent the first working television system in the world.

The US Department of Commerce issued its first experimental radio license in compliance with the International Radio Convention and Radio Act of 1912. St. Joseph's College received a license with serial number 1 to operate 2 kilowatts station 3XJ.
Adam Curry launched an RSS feed of audio recordings called "Daily Source Code" and podcasting became a thing.
